publish.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold
publish.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The first edition was published in 1765.
They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
publish.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a newspaper or magazine publishes a letter, article etc, it prints it for people to read
publish.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
publish.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make official information such as a report available for everyone to read
publish.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
publish.translation[0].definitions[2].no: Publish is often passive in this meaning
publish.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a writer, musician etc publishes their work, they arrange for it to be printed and sold
publish.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: University teachers must publish regularly to gain promotion.
publish.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to arrange the writing, production, and sale of a book, magazine etc
publish.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Her second novel was published in July.
We publish course books for language learners.
publish.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make official information such as a report available for everyone to read
publish.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
Public companies have to publish an annual report and accounts.
